Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hello. Jim?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What's up, buddy?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This is not funny. Why is my stuff in here?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow, that's weird. Oh, dollar for a stapler, that's pretty good.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, well, I'm not paying for my own stuff, okay? I know you did this, because you're friends with the vending machine guy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Who, Steve?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, Steve, whatever his name is.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sorry. What do I want? What do I want... Oh, it's a pencil cup.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no, no. That's my pencil cup.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Um, I don't think so, I just bought it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uh, I think so, and you're going to hand it over to me.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I love these.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, fine. Where's my wallet?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, there it is. J1.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: But I don't have any...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Here, you know what? You can have some nickels.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [putting quarters in] Five, ten, fifteen, twenty, twenty-five...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello, everyone.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Good morning, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Where are we going this afternoon?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ah! Ha ha ha!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Last week, Michael sent out this mysterious memo.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: "It's time for our first quarter camaraderie event, so pack a swimsuit, a toothbrush, rubber-soled shoes, and a ski mask."

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: A ski mask and a swimsuit.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So that he can have us rob a bank, and then escape through the sewers.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And brush our teeth.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Stanley! Bo banley.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I need to know...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Banana fana fo fanley.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: What we're doing.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Be my mo manley.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: You said bring a toothbrush.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Stanley.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Is this an overnight?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Maybe. The suspense is just so exciting, isn't it?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Should my wife tell her boss she's not coming in tomorrow?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Maybe, I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Not maybe. Yes or no.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, no. But... okay, don't spoil it for everybody, all right? But we are going on a booze cruise on Lake Wallenpaupack.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: In January?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's cheaper.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is not just another party. This is a leadership training exercise. Right? I'm going to combine elements of fun and motivation and education into a single mind-blowing experience.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It is now time to unveil the destination of this year's retreat. We are going on a harbor cruise of Lake Wallenpaupack. It's a booze cruise!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: All right!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I have a test for business school tomorrow night. Is it okay if I skip the cruise and study for that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. This is mandatory. But don't worry, you know what? You're gonna learn plenty. This is gonna turn your life around, Ryan.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I'm already in business school.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, this...

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Wait, Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Why did you tell us to bring a bathing suit?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: To throw you off the scent.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Yeah, but I bought a bathing suit.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, just keep the tags on and you can return it.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I took the tags off already.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, that's not my fault, okay? Just.. we're not going to pay for a bathing suit. Okay, I know what you're all thinking, "Who is this smart little cookie?" Her name is Brenda... something, and she is from corporate. And she is here, like you, to learn from what I have to say.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am a great motivational speaker. I attended a Tony Robbins event by the airport last year, and... it wasn't the actual course. You have to pay for the actual course. But it talked about the actual course. And I've incorporated a lot of his ideas into my own course.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Leader... ship. The word "ship" is hidden inside the word "leadership," as its derivation. So if this office is, in fact, a ship, as its leader, I am the captain. But we're all in the same boat. Teamwork!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Last year, Michael's theme was "Bowl over the Competition!" So guess where we went.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Now, on this ship that is the office, what is a sales department? Anyone?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: How about the sales department is the sails?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, Darryl, the sales department makes sales. Good. Let me just explain. I see the sales department as the furnace.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: A furnace?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeesh, how old is this ship?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: How about the anchor?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: What does the furnace do?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right, let's not get hung up on the furnace. This just... it's the sales... I see the sales department down there. They're in the engine room, and they are shoveling coal into the furnace, right? I mean, who saw the movie Titanic? They were very important in the movie Titanic. Who saw it? Show of hands!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm not really sure what movie you're talking about. Are you sure you got the title right?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Titanic?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I think you're thinking of The Hunt for Red October.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I'm Leo DiCaprio! Come on!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael stands in the front of the boat and says that he's king of the world within the first hour, or I give you my next paycheck.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Michael, everyone in the engine room drowned.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No! Thank you, spoiler alert. You saw the movie, those of you who did. They're happy down there in the furnace room. And they're dirty and grimy and sweaty, and they're singing their ethnic songs, and... actually, that might be warehouse.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The... no, no. No, I didn't... okay. Well, okay, in a nutshell, what I'm saying is... leadership. We'll talk more about that on the boat. Ship.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Aye aye, Captain.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [singing] A three-hour tour, a three-hour tour.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam, you are Mary Ann! We have the Professor and Ginger, welcome aboard. Angela, you are Mrs. Howell. Lovey. [to Kelly] Uh... the native. Sometimes they come from neighboring... [to Stanley] We have one of the Globetrotters, I am the Skipper, and Dwight, you will be Gilligan.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Cool.

Quote.Speaker: Captain Jack
Quote.Text: Actually, I'm the Skipper. But you can be Gilligan.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'd rather die. Hi, I am Michael Scott, I am the captain of this party.

Quote.Speaker: Captain Jack
Quote.Text: I am Captain Jack, I am captain of the ship. I'm also captain of anyone who sets foot on the ship. [to boarding passengers] Hi, welcome aboard.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: In an office, when you are ranking people, manager is higher than captain. On a boat, who knows? It's nebulose.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, look! I'm king of the world!

Quote.Speaker: Captain Jack
Quote.Text: Okay, all right! Welcome aboard! I am your captain, Captain Jack.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And I am the regional manager of Dunder-Mifflin, Michael Scott. Welcome, welcome!

Quote.Speaker: Captain Jack
Quote.Text: Okay! So...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay! So...

Quote.Speaker: Captain Jack
Quote.Text: Please. The life preservers.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Right.

Quote.Speaker: Captain Jack
Quote.Text: They are located underneath the seats, all along the border of the boat.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: But don't worry, you are not going to be needing life preservers tonight.

Quote.Speaker: Captain Jack
Quote.Text: Well, we might, okay? Please let me finish, okay? Thank you. So, the Coast Guard requires that I tell you where the safety exits are. On this ship, it's very easy. Anywhere over the side. [Dwight laughs loudly.] Not only am I your ship captain, I am also your party captain! Whoo! We're gonna get it going in just a few minutes here...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm your party captain too! And you are gonna put on your dancing shoes later on! So we are gonna...

Quote.Speaker: Captain Jack
Quote.Text: Okay, Michael, if you don't mind...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Rock it!

Quote.Speaker: Captain Jack
Quote.Text: Please, okay?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: If the boat's a-rockin', don't come knockin'!

Quote.Speaker: Captain Jack
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Captain Jack
Quote.Text: Your company's employees are not the only people on the boat tonight, okay?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We're all gonna have a good time tonight!

Quote.Speaker: Captain Jack
Quote.Text: Why don't you let me and my crew do our job. You just sit back and have a good time. All right?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hm? Okay. Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: You guys, it's like we're in high school and we're at the cool table. Right?

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Pam, were you a cheerleader?

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: No, she was totally Miss Artsy-Fartsy in high school. She wore the turtleneck and everything!

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: That's hilarious.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's not hilarious, but...

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Where did you go to school?

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Bishop O'Hara.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Piss slop who cares-a? We played you! You... you really look familiar. Did you... you cheered for them, didn't you?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Um, no.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Yes, I did! [chanting] A-W-E-S-O-M-E! Awesome! Awesome is what we are! We're the football superstars! A-W-E-S-O-M-E!

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: I remember that! We crushed you like 42-10!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Having fun?

Quote.Speaker: Brenda
Quote.Text: Yeah. Everybody's really nice.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good. Well, that is what Scranton is all about. Not like you New Yawkers.

Quote.Speaker: Brenda
Quote.Text: When are you going to start the presentation?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, we already sort of started it back at the office and on the dock with the Gilligan thing, so... right now, I was thinking. Yes. Okay, listen up all you Dunder-Mifflinites! I would like to talk to you all about life preservers. Now, one important life preserver in business is IT support.

Quote.Speaker: Captain Jack
Quote.Text: Not now, Mike, we're doing the limbo! That's right, partiers, it's time to limbo, limbo, limbo!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So, okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Limbo, whoo!

Quote.Speaker: Captain Jack
Quote.Text: All right! I need a volunteer to come up here and hold my stick. Who's it gonna be?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Me.

Quote.Speaker: Captain Jack
Quote.Text: Okay...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Me! Me, me, me.

Quote.Speaker: Captain Jack
Quote.Text: Uh... usually it's a woman.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm stronger.

Quote.Speaker: Captain Jack
Quote.Text: Hey, I got an idea! How would you like to steer the ship, Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Captain Jack
Quote.Text: Keep us on a steady course. Keep a sharp eye out. I'm counting on you!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I was the youngest pilot in Pan Am history. When I was four, the pilot let me ride in the cockpit and fly the plane with him. And I was four. And I was great. And I would have landed it, but my dad wanted us to go back to our seats.

Quote.Speaker: Captain Jack
Quote.Text: All right, all right, that was great! Now it's time for the dance contest!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: But before that, I have to do my presentation.

Quote.Speaker: Captain Jack
Quote.Text: Nope! Dance contest!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right, we'll have a motivational dance contest! Hit it! Yeah, okay, dancing! It is a primal art form used in ancient times to express yourself with the body and communicate!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sometimes you have to take a break from being the kind of boss that's always trying to teach people things. Sometimes you have to just be the boss of dancing.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [singing] What do you do with a drunken sailor? What do you do with a drunken sailor? What do you do with a drunken sailor early in the morning?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Hey, come inside and talk to me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I can't. Do you want us to run aground, woman?!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl and Katy
Quote.Text: [chanting] Snorkel shot! Snorkel shot!

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Whoo! Who's next? Come on, Pam! Come on! Come on!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, I'm not going to do that.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Come on!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: That's what I'm talking about!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, why don't we find like a quieter place to hang out?

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: I've just gotta wait for Darryl to do his shot. Just a minute. Come on! [chanting] Darryl! Darryl!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's getting kind of rowdy down there.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. [chanting] Darryl! Darryl! Darryl!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sometimes I just don't get Roy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I mean, I don't know. So... what's it like dating a cheerleader?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, um... [A long silence.]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm cold.

Quote.Speaker: Captain Jack
Quote.Text: So, what's this presentation all about?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ah! See, this is of general interest. It is about priorities and making decisions, using the boat as an analogy. What is important to you? If the boat is sinking, what do you save?

Quote.Speaker: Captain Jack
Quote.Text: Women and children.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no. Salesmen and profit centers.

Quote.Speaker: Captain Jack
Quote.Text: That's a stupid analogy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, well, obviously you don't know anything about leadership.

Quote.Speaker: Captain Jack
Quote.Text: Well, I was the captain of a PC-1 Cyclone Coastal Patrol Boat during Desert Storm.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wow. You should be the motivational speaker.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah. He gives me real responsibility, Michael. Captain Jack delegates. He's let me steer the ship for the last hour.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: I'd like to be engaged. How did you manage to pull that off?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Uh, I've been engaged for three years, and there's no end in sight. So... you don't wanna ask my advice.

Quote.Speaker: Captain Jack
Quote.Text: Suppose your office building's on fire. Jim, who would you save?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Um... let's see, uh... The customer. Because the customer is king.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Not what I was looking for, but a good thought.

Quote.Speaker: Captain Jack
Quote.Text: He's just sucking up!

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: When you were in the Navy, did you ever almost die?

Quote.Speaker: Captain Jack
Quote.Text: Oh yeah, oh yeah. And I wasn't thinking about some customer. I was thinking about my first wife. The day I got back on shore, I married her.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know what? I would save the receptionist. I just wanted to clear that up.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Hello, everybody, could I have your attention for just a second? Could you listen to me for a second? We were up at the front, and we were talking about what's really important, and... Pam, I think enough is enough. I think we should set a date for our wedding. How about June 10th? Come on, let's do it! Come on, Pam!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't want to take credit for this, but Roy and I were just having a conversation about making commitments and making choices. Right? Did I motivate you?

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: No, it was Captain Jack.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well... could have been either one of us, because we were pretty much saying the same thing. Congratulations. That is great!

Quote.Speaker: Captain Jack
Quote.Text: We gotta celebrate! Hey, I got an idea, I got an idea. I can marry you right now, as captain of the ship!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes! I can marry you as regional manager of Dunder-Mifflin!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, no, I want my mom and dad to be there.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Then I'll give you away!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Do you think that'll ever be us?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: What is wrong with you? Why did you even bring me here tonight?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't know. Let's break up.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Whoa. What?

Quote.Speaker: Captain Jack
Quote.Text: This is where Captain Jack drives the boat.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Wow!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Seasick? Captain Jack says you should look at the Moon.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Captain Jack is a fart face. I'm on medication.

Quote.Speaker: Brenda
Quote.Text: Really? What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Vomicillin. Okay. All right. It's time to be boss. It's time to motivate. Let's blow some minds here. Okay, guys, guys, cool it. Everybody, Dunder-Mifflin Scranton employees, Brenda, I have some very, very urgent news I need to tell everybody right now. Listen up. The ship is sinking! Okay? We're going down, right now. Just wrap your heads around the reality of that. Shh, please! Everybody, it's my turn now, okay? Captain Jack is gone. In five minutes, this ship is going to be at the bottom of the lake! And there aren't enough spaces on the lifeboat! Who are we gonna save? Do we save sales? Do we save customer service? Do we save accounting? This is a business scenario. Right? It's a scary... it's a...

Quote.Speaker: Captain Jack
Quote.Text: Hey! Hey! What the hell is going on here?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's a predicament, and it's something that each and every one of us has to think about.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm in the brig. See? The boat's not as corporate-friendly as advertised. What was the deal with the guy jumping overboard? What was... if he had just waited and heard what I had to say, he would be motivated right now and not all wet.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Is somebody there?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What happened to you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Captain Jack has a problem with authority.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, right, because you announced that his ship was sinking?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: He just totally lost it. If you ask me, he caused the panic.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What a night.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, it's nice for you. Your friend got engaged.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: She was always engaged.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Roy said the first one didn't count.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's... great. You know, to tell the truth, I used to have a big thing for Pam, so...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really? You're kidding me. You and Pam? Wow. I would have never have put you two together. You really hid it well. God! I usually have a radar for stuff like that. You know, I made out with Jan...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, I know.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah? Yep. Well, Pam is cute.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. She's really funny, and she's warm. And she's just... well, anyway.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, if you like her so much, don't give up.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: She's engaged.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: BFD. Engaged ain't married.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Huh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Never, ever, ever give up.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Don't worry, Michael. I'm taking us to shore.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's a fake wheel, dummy.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Are you all packed?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Yes, I brought my duffel bag and a sleeping bag.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Where do you guys think we're going?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Definitely some place you can swim.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Right.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Maybe Florida.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Did you hear something?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [knocking] Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Hello, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Can we come in?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Of course, yeah, yeah, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Thank you very much.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Have a seat.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Brenda.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, every man's dream.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Oh, really? A surprise visit from his boss?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Two ladies at once. What? Why are you looking at me like that? Okay, you heard something. Um, yeah, it's a booze cruise, but it... There's more to the story than that. It...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: A booze cruise? What do you mean?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Leadership off-site. Uh, booze cruise is just a rhyme...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Michael, we discussed the IRS's regulations.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, I don't even know why I said booze cruise. I don't even think there's booze on the boat.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Okay, this event has to have legitimate business content to be tax deductible.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Of course.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: We discussed that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Of course, of course. Yes. Yes. Look, I have a whole program planned. Jan, this program is going to change people's lives. I am going to be dropping serious knowledge all over the boat.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Good. This is Brenda Matlow from corporate training.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I thought she could attend tonight, and if your event is appropriate, you could give it to other branches.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, cool. Cool. And maybe you could attend tonight and then you could stay over at my house for the night. Awkward. That's... You know what. Brenda, could Jan and I have a moment alone?

Quote.Speaker: Brenda
Quote.Text: Jan said if you asked me that I was supposed to say no.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really? You seriously said that? Okay. Brenda, could Jan and I have a moment alone?

Quote.Speaker: Brenda
Quote.Text: Sure...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Brenda.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Brenda
Quote.Text: I mean, no.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Okay, you know, I'm gonna go now, and...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Good luck, Brenda.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'll see you later.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Okay, see you later. And try to be professional.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'll call you later.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: No, that's all right.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's like...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: You call me if you need anything, Brenda.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'll call you, too. [to Brenda] So. You are probably gonna get carded, so I can make you a fake ID. We have a laminating machine.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What is a sales department? Oscar, what do you think?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I don't know what the categories are of workers on a boat.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm not giving you the answer. Deck hands is one. And...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, oh, can I be the first mate?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I'm first mate. You're second mate. I'm first mate, as the captain.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: How about the anchor?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, the anchor is the only thing that kind of slows the ship down. Toby is the anchor. Oh, God. He, well... [to Brenda] Tell you about Toby later, he's awful.

Quote.Speaker: Brenda
Quote.Text: Yeah, I know Toby from Jan's birthday.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hey, Brenda.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, hey, Toby. So... It's an analogy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Toby running to get on the cruise] Hey! What's wrong with you? You missed the boat.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I got lost.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Idiot.

Quote.Speaker: Captain Jack
Quote.Text: We can go back.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no. That's his punishment for not being here on time. Too bad, anchor!

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I guess I shouldn't have stopped for dinner.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: On the high seas, Captain Jack is the leader. On the land it's Michael. On the ramp up to the boat, I was a bit conflicted. But now that I'm here, I'll follow Captain Jack to hell and back.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey, Captain Jack, what kind of fish they got in this lake?

Quote.Speaker: Captain Jack
Quote.Text: Perch, bass.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You know, my grandfather told me there was a monster here that eats Catholics. Have you heard...

Quote.Speaker: Captain Jack
Quote.Text: I haven't heard that, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: If the hull is breached for any reason or the boat is overtaken, I am a volunteer Sheriff's Deputy, and you can count on me.

Quote.Speaker: Captain Jack
Quote.Text: That's good to know, Dwight. Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Your problem now, Captain Jack.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey. You know what the best way of studying is?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: At home, not on a boat?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Flash cards.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Flash cards. Doesn't really help me right now because I'm on a boat.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You are gonna get seasick if you keep reading in here.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Well...

Quote.Speaker: Captain Jack
Quote.Text: Yeah! All right. All right. That was awesome. All right, looks like the guitar player's gonna take a little break. So this'd be a great time to head on over to the taco bar. All right.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That is a great way to kill this party. Not on my watch. Let's, uh,... Let's rock. Let's rock some stuff here, okay? [playing badly] Okay... I'm hearing a little too much reverb. [feedback echoing] Can we down the reverb? All right. Follow my lead. [playing Smoke on the Water] Does you guys know that? Take the bass. Take the drums. What?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Do you want me to give it a shot? Just...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what? I don't think it's in...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's not in tune. I don't know if you can...

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I don't know, let's try.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...make much of out of it, Creed. Good luck to you. I don't know. It is a defective ax, my friend.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good luck.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Guys, E, blues. Follow me, okay? [playing well]

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Back in the '60s, I was with the Grass Roots. We toured with Janis Joplin, The Doors, Cream. We had a lot of fun, And now I do quality assurance for a paper company. As you can imagine, drugs played a part. They still do. My work calls last about 90 seconds, and that's about as long as I can concentrate.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Those slide moves are just bush league. I hope I die before I'm old.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [throwing up]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [speaking Spanish] Por favor, tequila seoor.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I think you've had enough.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: What you say, bitch? You know, you might be right.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You've been to the lake before?

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Yes, I have. [kisses Pam]

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Should have done it a long time ago.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes, you should have.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: I do what's right whenever I figure it out. I love you, babe.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Love you.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: You should make a toast.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, I really don't want to.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Jim, come on, don't be shy.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Everybody, everybody? There is a toast. Come on...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah! Toast!

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Yeah, toast! Toast! Toast!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thanks, Katy. Um, didn't really prepare anything to say. We're all caught pretty unprepared with this whirlwind courtship. I guess I just wanna say that Pam is the greatest. My best friend. And she's awesome. And...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, okay. My turn, my turn. Is this thing on? Uh, I want to congratulate the happy couple. You know, they say that marriage is an institution. And I say, who wants to be in an institution?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's my line! That's my line, That's... I always say that at weddings. So I'll just think of something else to say. I... [band starts playing]

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Cheers.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, Jim. You got a hat?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [to Angela] So this is...

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [storms out of Michael's office] Well, we're not going to Florida.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh. Someplace with a pool, then?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [gives Phyllis a look]
